channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Red Marks Spray Painted, 27th August
item.description:
Red marks have been spray painted over the white of the zebra crossing near the Rose of Denmark pub on the Woolwich Road. This is distracting, unsightly and should be removed with urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 325, Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip, 27th August
item.description:
I reported the flytipping under report 8073703 but you say it is not Bromley Councils land. However it is a public path and the flytip is underneath a sign erected by Bromley Council and the path forms a public footpath to Mottingham Woods which is owned by the Bromley Council. Please arrange, if it is not Veolias job for the cannisters to be cleared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Street Hill, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Growth at the bottom of a tree almost blocking the pavement., 27th August
item.description:
Spikey branches have been growing from the bottom of the tree outside of 12 Oswyth Road and are almost blocking the pavement, making it very difficult for prams and wheelchairs to use the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Oswyth Road, Peckham, London
